About

I am currently a founding product manager at Airflip, a vendor intelligence platform for enterprise procurement teams. I launched our intial product, leading the development of our vendor research, deal management workflows, and AI-driven spend analytics.

Previously, I was as an Optimization Specialist at Blackrock working on their Aladdin risk and trading platform. I was responsible for delivering new optimization use cases, supporting 10+ enterprise clients, and driving optimization adoption for portfolio construction and risk management tools.

I have a BA in Data Science with an emphasis on Cognition and AI from UC Berkeley. While in school, I worked for the Division of Data Science, where I led a marketing team to promote the launch of the new data science major. I was also the Chief Marketing Officer for ML@B, Berkeley’s machine learning club, where I created strategic content showcasing the academic and industry applications of machine learning.

     Walkthrough of portfolio optimization, with insights drawn from my work on Aladdin at BlackRock.

     Designed an A/B test project to analyze a feature’s impact on user engagement and conversion rates.

    Led a cross-functional team at Airflip to design and launch a form builder for procurement teams.

     Created Python prototypes of spend analytics visuals for Airflip, providing engineering with clear implementation steps.

    Led Airflip’s website and product documentation redesign, improving usability and brand alignment.

    Authored articles on procurement concepts and created content for UC Berkeley Marketing initiatives.
